text: Job Regrets His Birth
⸤Afterward⸥\f + \fr 3:1 \ft Literally “After thus” \f* Job opened his mouth and cursed\f + \fr 3:1 \ft A different term than that employed in 1:5, 11; 2:5, 9 \f* his day.
Thus\f + \fr 3:2 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Job ⸤spoke up⸥\f + \fr 3:2 \ft Literally “answered” \f* and said,
“Let \add the\add* day perish on which I was born,
and the night that said, ‘A man-child is conceived.’
Let that day become\f + \fr 3:4 \ft Or “be” \f* darkness;
may God not seek it from above,
nor may daylight shine on it.
Let darkness and deep shadow claim it;
let clouds\f + \fr 3:5 \ft Literally “cloud” \f* settle on it;
let them\f + \fr 3:5 \ft Masculine plural referring to all three entities mentioned in this verse \f* terrify it \add with the\add* blackness\f + \fr 3:5 \ft Literally “blacknesses” \f* of day.
Let darkness seize that night;\f + \fr 3:6 \ft Literally “That night, let darkness seize it” \f*
let it not rejoice among \add the\add* days of \add the\add* year;
let it not enter among \add the\add* number of \add the\add* months.
Look, let that night become\f + \fr 3:7 \ft Or “be” \f* barren;
let a joyful song not enter it.
Let those who curse the day curse it,
those who are skilled at rousing Leviathan.
Let the stars of its dawn be dark;
let it hope for light but\f + \fr 3:9 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* there be none,
and let it not see \add the\add* eyelids of dawn
because it did not shut the doors of my \add mother’s\add* womb,
nor\f + \fr 3:10 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* did it hide trouble from my eyes.
Job Wishes He Had Died
“Why did I not die at\f + \fr 3:11 \ft Literally “from” \f* birth?
\add Why\add* did I \add not\add* come forth from \add the\add* womb and expire?
Why did \add the\add* knees receive me
and the breasts, that I could suck?
For now I would lie down, and I would be at peace;
I would be asleep; then ⸤I would be at rest⸥\f + \fr 3:13 \ft Literally “it would be at rest for me” \f*
with kings and counselors of \add the\add* earth,
who ⸤rebuild⸥ \f + \fr 3:14 \ft Literally “build” \f* ruins for themselves,
or with high officials ⸤who have gold⸥,\f + \fr 3:15 \ft Literally “gold \fq is \ft for them” \f*
who fill up their houses \add with\add* silver.
Or \add why\add* was I not hidden like a miscarriage,
like infants \add who\add* did not see \add the\add* light?
There \add the\add* wicked cease from troubling,
and there \add the\add* ⸤weary⸥\f + \fr 3:17 \ft Literally “weary of strength” \f* are at rest;
\add the\add* prisoners are at ease together;
they do not hear \add the\add* oppressor’s voice.
\add The\add* small and \add the\add* great \add are\add* there,
and \add the\add* slave \add is\add* free from his masters.\f + \fr 3:19 \ft Or “master” \f*
Job Wishes He Might Die
“Why does he\f + \fr 3:20 \ft Most likely God \f* give light to one in misery
and life to \add those\add* bitter of soul,
who wait for death, but\f + \fr 3:21 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* ⸤it does not come⸥,\f + \fr 3:21 \ft Literally “it \fq is \ft not” \f*
and search\f + \fr 3:21 \ft Or “dig” \f* \add for\add* it more than \add for\add* treasures,
who rejoice ⸤exceedingly⸥,\f + \fr 3:22 \ft Literally “unto rejoicing” \f*
\add and\add* they are glad when they find \add the\add* grave?
\add Why does he\f + \fr 3:23 \ft Most likely God \f* give light\add* to a man whose way is hidden,
and God has fenced him in \add all\add* around?
For\f + \fr 3:24 \ft Or perhaps emphatic, “Indeed” \f* my sighing comes ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 3:24 \ft Or “in place of” (NET); literally “to the faces of” \f* my bread,\f + \fr 3:24 \ft Or “food” \f*
and my groanings gush forth like water
because the dread that I ⸤feel⸥\f + \fr 3:25 \ft Literally “dread” \f* has come upon me,
and what I feared befalls me.
I am not at ease, and I am not at peace,
and I do not have rest, thus\f + \fr 3:26 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* turmoil has come.”
